justifications: Vladimir Putin has been trying to downplay the significance of the incursion.
The Kremlin's messaging is directed at the local Russian population and suggests that Moscow expects the surprise occupation of its territory to last for months.
Volodymyr Zelensky, the Ukrainian president, has stated that the goal is to create a 'buffer zone' inside Russia.
The Kremlin strongly believes that it can get the public to accept almost anything.
The new propaganda effort is designed to paint the occupation as the 'new normal' to settle the public mood.
Moscow has also been trying to justify its continued military focus on eastern Ukraine, where Russia is still advancing, over the expulsion of Ukrainian troops in Kursk.
Vladimir Putin has been trying to downplay the significance of the incursion.
There have been no patriotic surge from locals in Kursk.
Putin has not been humiliated, yet there is also not enough anger at the Ukrainian operation to persuade people to join the fight.
